info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 8:38PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berkshire County through 945 PM EDT... At 837 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Becket, or 9 miles southeast of Pittsfield, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lee, Lenox, Becket, Otis, Sandisfield, New Marlborough, Monterey, Peru, Washington, Tyringham, Konkapot, New Boston, North Otis, Montville, New Lenox, Lenox Dale, Southfield, The Center At Lenox, East Otis and Cold Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
